programme.title: Lightoller and Dunkirk
programme.desc: It turns out Titanic was only Act I for Charles Lightoller. Twenty-eight years after Titanic, he was at the helm of his own boat navigating through enemy fire while rescuing British troops from Dunkirk. He was a true British hero!

programme.title: Should The Lookouts Have Had Binoculars? - Parks Stephenson REV
programme.desc: Why didn’t the lookouts have binoculars? If they had, could the disaster have been avoided? This is always a big debate around Titanic circles. Parks Stephenson’s answers to these questions may surprise you.

programme.title: Selling Second Class
programme.desc: Senan Molony gives us a rare look at a Titanic advertising brochure directed at second-class passengers. What White Star was selling in the cutthroat world of transatlantic competition back in 1912, might surprise you.

programme.title: Was Captain Smith Legally in Command of the Titanic?
programme.desc: Senan Molony has uncovered a completely overlooked Irish document, that seems to confirm Captain Smith was not legally in command of Titanic when she sailed from Southampton on April 10, 1912.

programme.title: Remembering Eva Hart
programme.desc: Charles Haas reflects on his friend, Titanic survivor Eva Hart, in an emotional never before told story of their last encounter and Eva’s surprising change of heart about recovering artifacts.

programme.title: The Captain's Table
programme.desc: First class trans-Atlantic travel is synonymous with fine dining. For the select few, the ultimate dining experience is to be invited to the Captain’s table. Sauder takes us back in time and gives us a seat at Captain Smith’s table.

programme.title: Titanic’s Pumps
programme.desc: Titanic’s engineers have always been an enduring story as they struggled with the pumps downstairs trying to keep them going to the very end. Was there ever any hope in their heroism?

programme.title: Shipwreck Diving
programme.desc: With the recent discovery of the German submarine in the North Sea, we decided to go into the archives and take another look at Richie Kohler’s Shipwreck Diving. In this remarkable episode, Richie tells of his own extraordinary discovery of a World...

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: Expansion Joints
programme.desc: Harland & Wolff decided to fit expansion joints into Olympic’s superstructure to protect the ships deck houses. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside tells us how they worked and why they were needed.

programme.title: Fixing The Wireless
programme.desc: If Jack Phillips had followed the rules, the wireless set would have still been broken the night the Titanic hit the iceberg and the Carpathia may never have received the distress call in time. Instead, Jack took initiative and fixed it himself and...

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Titanic's Most Refined Features
programme.desc: Titanic Historian Bill Sauder continues his look at Titanic’s remarkable First Class Lounge. In this episode, Sauder reveals the architectural and decorative point of view and shows why the room was a showcase onboard the ship.

programme.title: Two Bath Tubs
programme.desc: There were only two bathtubs for all 709 Third Class passengers aboard Titanic. Sauder explains why probably no one in Third Class complained!

programme.title: The Story Behind Titanic's Real Time Sinking
programme.desc: Tom Lynskey and Matt DeWinkeleer take us behind the scenes of their amazingly popular 2 hour 40 minute Titanic Sinks in REAL TIME. With over 17,670,154 views, it definitely captured the world’s attention.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Was Olympic Retired Too Soon?
programme.desc: Olympic was taken out of service in 1935, after nearly a quarter of a century of a very successful career. Was she retired too soon? It certainly seems there was still plenty of life in her. Mark Chirnside looks at the reasons she was scrapped and why...

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: The Untold Story of the Titanic Deck Chair
programme.desc: The Titanic story goes out in so many different directions and this is one of them! A Titanic deck chair, recovered by the Mackay-Bennett and later auctioned, provides us with a new Titanic Story that you might not have heard before from Craig Sopin!

programme.title: The Story Behind the New Titanic Photo
programme.desc: It’s been described as one of the most spectacular photographs of Titanic ever seen. Where did it come from? Andrew Aldridge will give us the backstory behind this remarkable photograph.

programme.title: The J.J. Davies Bag
programme.desc: As bodies were recovered on the Mackay-Bennett, they were given a number and the personal items found on the body were put into a mortuary bag. This is the real life story of one of those bags from Body No. 200!

programme.title: The Last Remaining Lifeboat
programme.desc: John White, from White Star Memories, takes us through the preservation of Nomadic’s last lifeboat. From her discovery in France to her Belfast restoration, White Star’s last remaining lifeboat carries on the legacy.

programme.title: The Gimbal Lamp
programme.desc: One of the features that really set Titanic apart from other ships was her interior illumination. Titanic Channel Host, Bill Sauder, introduces us to a simple, versatile lamp that was used throughout the ship.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: Exploring Titanic
programme.desc: Called Titanic’s “Greatest Explorer,” PH Nargeolet takes us deep inside the wreck for a revealing look at Titanic’s interior.

programme.title: Nadelhorn Via Normal Route - The Best Alpine Experience
programme.desc: Cris and Viv are hiking to the summit of Nadelhorn (4,327 m), which lies in the Mischabel group in Switzerland. We follow their adventure from the village of Saas-Fee to the Mischabel Hut, a mountain hut that lies at an elevation of 3,340 meters and that has beautiful views of Lenzspitze, Dom, Nadelhorn, Weissmies, and many other 4000-meter peaks. And finally after having crossed the Hohbalmgletscher, they go over the North-East ridge to get to the summit of Nadelhorn which offers superb views of the Alps and their summits such as the Weisshorn and the famous Matterhorn.

programme.title: Engadin Ski Marathon 2024
programme.desc: The Engadin Skimarathon is the second largest cross-country skiing event in the world and the largest cross-country skiing event in Switzerland. Among the large crowd of participants are also world-class runners. Every year, Switzerlands largest sports event attracts more than 11000 cross-country fans from over 67 nations to the Upper Engadin valley.

programme.title: 5 Torri Winter Hike
programme.desc: We snow shoe in the heart of the Dolomites, above Cortina, to the enchanted 5 Torri and stop at the Rifuggio Scoiattolo for refreshments. Nous partons en raquettes au cœur des Dolomites, au-dessus de Cortina, jusquaux magnifiques "5 Torri" et nous nous arrêtons au Rifuggio Scoiattolo pour nous rafraîchir.

programme.title: Open Faces 2024
programme.desc: The most important Freeride World Tour Qualifier Series in Europe celebrated the start of the 10th season with the 2* FWT Qualifier competition. In challenging conditions the riders show their skills and offer top-class performances on the Quellspitze in Kappl/Paznaun.

programme.title: World Rookie Snowboard Finals 2025
programme.desc: After traveling across Europe, North America, and Japan and witnessing the most motivated riders battling for a spot in the World Rookie Snowboard Finals 2025, the Black Yeti is ready to welcome the next generation of World Rookie Tour Champions. Only the top young snowboarders from the World Rookie Tour stops have earned their place in this legendary event. This year marks a historic milestone—the 20th anniversary of the World Rookie Snowboard Finals, the competition that has launched the careers of some of today’s top snowboarders.

programme.title: Nendaz FWT Challenger 2025
programme.desc: This year, Nendaz Freeride returns to the FWT Challenger, the final stage of the legendary Freeride World Tour, confirming its place among the best freeride competitions. The faces of Mont-Gond offer athletes an infinite number of lines and ideal conditions in which to practice their art. Thats why it attracts so many international freeriders in search of thrills and spills.

programme.title: World Rookie Snowboard Finals 2024
programme.desc: The World Rookie Snowboard Finals are an iconic event in the world of youth snowboarding, where emerging athletes have the chance to test themselves and compete against the best in their category becoming a star! The Finals are back in style at the historic location of Kitzsteinhorn Zell am See-Kaprun, for a six-day contest and non-stop activities, providing an exceptional setting and unparalleled snow conditions for this high-level competition. This prestigious event determines the new 2024 World Rookie Champions title for Snowboard Halfpipe and Slopestyle, who earn the opportunity to participate in renowned international competitions and training camps in 2024.

programme.title: Open Faces 2024 Montafon
programme.desc: The Freeride Contest in Montafon (AUT) offers even more of the worlds best freeriders who will be at the start of the 4* contest. The terrain surrounding "little Heimspitze" in the Silvretta-Montafon region will be the venue for this years Open Faces Freeride Contest in Vorarlberg. This 4* FWT qualifier offers riders 2500 point and a rich prize money for a victory.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 #3
programme.desc: Cette 3e et avant dernière étape servait de répétition du grand final de demain où, si la météo le permet, la course franchira le col de la Forclaz. Ce col situé au pied du Grand Mont est le théâtre d’une communion, sans égale depuis39 ans, entre les coureurs et les milliers de spectateurs massés à 2.374 m.

programme.title: Highest Peak on Vancouver's North Shore - BRUNSWICK MOUNTAIN (Eng)
programme.desc: We summit Brunswick Mountain, the highest peak on Vancouvers North Shore, followed by Mt. Harvey right next to it. This video was filmed on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples - Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), Tsleil-Waututh & Musqueam First Nations.

programme.title: Expedition Antarctica of extreme sports woman Caro North
programme.desc: Iceclimbing, ski mountaineering and sailing the open water for days through the infamous Drake Passage: The 28 years old extreme sports woman Caro North made her way to the very South of our continent for a four weeks expedition – accompanied by an eight-member crew. Antarctica turned out to be a paradise for extreme sports: deserted landscapes and snow-capped mountains against a surreal backdrop of ice and sea were waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 #2
programme.desc: Les coureurs ont pu profiter de la ferveur populaire des habitants du village d’Arêches, au départ de cette2e étape, pour faire le plein d’énergie. Cette communion avec le public beaufortain faisait figure de prologue à une étape décrite par les participants comme la plus difficile vécue avec ses 5 cols, 31 km, 3350 m de D+ et 3165 m deD-. Les chutes de neige de la nuit encore actives le matin ont largement contribué à alourdir l’effort malgré un énorme travail des bénévoles pour entretenir la trace.

programme.title: Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025
programme.desc: Nestled in the heart of the Swiss Alps, the Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025 is one of the most exciting events on the freeride calendar. This unique competition brings together some of the world’s top backcountry athletes, showcasing their incredible skills and creativity in untouched snow.

programme.title: Golden Trail Series - Chasing Dreams 2023 - Ep 7 The Final - Part 2 (Eng)
programme.desc: In the epic conclusion of the Golden Trail Series, tensions surge after a gripping prologue, tightening the rankings among the top athletes. The Kenyans eye the podium, Rémi Bonnet faces a title threat, and Elhousine is looking for glory. Meanwhile, the fierce competition between Sophia and Judith heats up as Madalina Florea emerges, ready to shake the standings.

programme.title: Golden Trail Series - Chasing Dreams Season 2022 - Episode 7 Strategic Decision (Eng)
programme.desc: The rankings are very tight during this 5-day stage race in Madeira, the top spots are almost secured, but to get a spot inside the top ten is the real challenge. Decision- making will be key throughout this final. This year’s rookie, Sophia Laukli, will have to make tough decisions to defend her position at the end of this season.

programme.title: Dark Peak Fell Runners
programme.desc: The Dark Peak Fell Runners base themselves in Sheffield, but their playground is the Peak District National Park where they weave tracks through the fields, peat bogs and rocky outcrops to create a tapestry of eccentricity, endeavour and endurance. As one of the biggest pure fell running clubs in the UK, the ‘Dark Peak Fell Runners’ captures the personality, quirks and successes of the club and its members. Shot throughout the course of a year, the film follows in their footsteps to reveal their well-trodden Peak District running routes including the club’s flagship race, the Edale Skyline. (Special Thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: X-out Montenegro
programme.desc: X-out Montenegro is part of the Xtri World Tour. Athletes starts with a 1.7 km open-water course. The race is started by the Xekutioner, a formidable figure who will be responsible for future eliminations. 15 of athletes will be eliminated by the Xekutioner, intensifying the competition. Eliminated athletes are given a time penatly and can then try to catch “The Splitter” to ovetake backmarkers and get back in the race! Then a tough and demanding 40 km asphalt cycle which climbs the famous serpentine above Kotor. Designed to test endurance to the max. Another 15 of athletes are eliminated by the Xekutioner here, ensuring only the toughest stay. Finally 6.5 km of downhill trail running and 2.5 km of “vertical” monster climbing. Again eliminated athletes have the opportunity to catch the leaders.

programme.title: Inside UTMB 2022
programme.desc: UTMB is considered the super bowl of trail running, and with over 10,000 metres of elevation gain, its widely considered to also be one of the most difficult races in the world. This year, Audrée and Jeff would both have the chance to toe the starting line, and this film will show you both of their perspectives with an intimate look at this incredible event.

programme.title: Fundamental aspects
programme.desc: Buying a boat requires thorough research and it is important to focus on some fundamental aspects. Maurizio Bulleri, aboard the Mar-co R-Evolution X36, guides you in the search of your “ideal boat”.

programme.title: Midnight Express SV 43 Lamborghini
programme.desc: The Boat Show is at the Miami International Boat Show, on board the motorboat Midnight Express SV 43 Lamborghini. Discover this incredible showstopper!

programme.title: Pirelli 35 WA - An exceptional rib
programme.desc: The Pirelli 35 WA by TecnoRib is a walkaround with aerodynamic lines and a contemporary and gritty look. The aesthetics are cured and the performances are not any less worthy.

programme.title: Regal 38 SAV - Sport Activity Vessel
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Annapolis Boat Show to introduce you to the REGAL 38 SAV (Sport Activity Vessel). Discover all about this incredible motorboat

programme.title: Dynamic D305V - Smooth performance, smoothly stylish
programme.desc: Dynamic D305V is one of the bests in the game by its slim and narrow model that serves active trimming of the water ever so smoothly.

programme.title: Deep Impact 499 Sport – Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is aboard the incredible Deep Impact 499 Sport center console. This boat immediately attracts attention and is equipped with 5 powerful Yamaha Mercury 500 Racing engines.

programme.title: Schaefer 660 - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Miami International Boat Show on board Schaefer 660.

programme.title: Rosetti Superyachts 38M - A strong DNA
programme.desc: Rosetti Superyachts was born from the Rosetti Marine shipyard. In the DNA lies the strength of industrial boats, which are subjected to extreme conditions. The new Rosetti 38 Explorer moves in this direction, with a steel hull and great autonomy.

programme.title: Pardo E72 - Elegance and autonomy on stage in Palm Beach
programme.desc: The brand new Pardo E72 debuts at the Palm Beach International Boat Show 2025. Part of the Endurance line, this model stands out for its generous volumes, contemporary design and solutions designed to ensure comfort and efficiency during long navigations.

programme.title: Viking - Range - FLIBS 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett takes you to the Fort Lauderdale Boat Show to discover the Viking Yachts range.

programme.title: Sanlorenzo SP110 - FLIBS 2022
programme.desc: Displayed at the Fort Lauderdale’s Boat Show was the Sanlorenzo SP110. This model belongs to a new series that embodies the concept of lightness and also a new approach to design.

programme.title: Extra Yachts X76 at Cannes
programme.desc: Bill Hackett welcomes you onboard the new amazing Extra Yachts X76 Loft, a revolutionary superyacht built in Italy by Extra Yachts, a brand of Palumbo Superyachts.

programme.title: Evergreen charm
programme.desc: The Magnum 70 Pegasus has lots of special features onboard and is a racing boat that is once of a kind. Built 15 years ago, this boat exudes an evergreen charm. As velocity is key for this boat, almost everything on board has been changed to make sure it resulted as light as it possibly can, even the closets are made of fabric.

programme.title: Cranchi 67 - Habitable solutions
programme.desc: With its 150 years of history, Cranchi boasts a glorious past and a promising present, and will make you dream with its new image. Come and discover the Cranchi 67, a yacht that offers habitability and furnishing solutions, typical of larger boats.

programme.title: A new point of reference
programme.desc: Discover a yacht that is different from the ones in the same category and that offers an intense interaction with the sea. With its luxurious style and magnificent interior and exterior spaces, the Bluegame BGX 70 is destined to be a point of reference for other boats.

programme.title: Tankoa Solo - A nautical masterpiece
programme.desc: The Boat Show offers you a special seat to discover magnificent vessels, inside and out. That’s the turn of the Tankoa Solo, a superyacht with a long story and was built with the only goal to be perfect in every way. Discover all the work behind this Italian masterpiece.

programme.title: Heesen Project Cosmos
programme.desc: The Boat Show brings you to The Netherlands for an exclusive experience. Discover Heesen Shipyard and its Project Cosmos, the superyacht Galactica, still under construction. It will measure 80.07 meters with a top speed of 29 knots, it is going to be the world’s largest and fastest full-aluminum motoryacht.

programme.title: Tesoro Yachts - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Tesoro Yachts is a new but very strong company that is ready to blow your mind. Discover all about it with Bill Hackett.

programme.title: Prestige X60 - X-Line Flying Bridge Yacht (Eng)
programme.desc: Hop on board the Prestige X60, an incredible superyacht on which to spend unforgettable days, surrounded by music, fun and relaxation.

programme.title: WallyWhy200 - A revolutionary yacht
programme.desc: Our Antonio Vettese brings you on board the revolutionary WallyWhy200, an ultra-luxury yacht that will blow your mind. This model is innovative in many aspects, one of them is the ground-breaking owner’s suite at the bow, where the hull has been thoroughly studied to ensure that silence and comfort are preserved, even at maximum speed.

programme.title: Extra X99 Fast – On board a luxury yacht
programme.desc: The Boat Show is on board the new Extra X99 Fast, a luxury yacht that will let you experience the thrill of speed on the sea.

programme.title: Viking Yachts Miami 2023 - Discover the best boats with Viking Yachts
programme.desc: Pat Healy, President and CEO of Viking Yachts, highlights the key importance of boat constructions and advanced design developments towards the better future of boating.

programme.title: Pearl 72 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: Worldwide premier of the Pearl 72, discover this incredible flybridge with many areas where to relax. Exceptional seakeeping, designed to follow the success of its sistership.

programme.title: Ultimate Express
programme.desc: Build your body with Terry Simpson and 10 exercises for time-challenged toners.

programme.title: Super 7 Overview
programme.desc: Follow along with this introduction to the Super 7 components of the fitness program.

programme.title: A Rose on Ninth Street
programme.desc: Set in South Philadelphia, A Rose on Ninth Street, deals with police corruption, crime, loyalty, drugs, romance, love, forgiveness, and redemption. Bob OConner is faced with the biggest decision of his life when he falls in love with the beautiful...

programme.title: 2nd Is The First Loser
programme.desc: Episode 4 of Pure Stock, the newest division of stock car racing is for the absolute beginner. With a 4-cylinder junkcar and a few hundred bucks, anyone can drive a racecar and win. In this episode the drivers attend NASCAR fan fest in downtown Joilet,...

programme.title: Travel Girls Episode 13
programme.desc: This exciting reality series six girls have been chosen to compete for the chance to be a television star with their own travel show.

programme.title: Dead Retribution
programme.desc: When Detective Seamus Kilpatrick is killed in the line of duty, he is brought back to bring his killer and who ever is involved to justice.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2025
programme.desc: The Val Thorens Pro showcases the world’s best free-riders on the Lac Noir face in dream conditions.

programme.title: Ultimate Mountain Athlete
programme.desc: The Ultimate Mountain Athlete pits pros across three alpine sports in Colorado's rugged San Juan Mountains.

programme.title: Ultimate Mountain Athlete
programme.desc: We then make our way to Red Mountain, where the athletes compete in the Vertical Sprint and then the downhill.

programme.title: Ultimate Mountain Athlete
programme.desc: The athletes transition to the Big Mountain Descent and start an Air DH flow bike race.

programme.title: Ultimate Mountain Athlete
programme.desc: The athletes continue with the downhill bike race high and navigate a free ski contest back on Red Mountain 3.

programme.title: 48 hours with Captain Durney
programme.desc: This is 48 Hours is with Capt. Oney Durney at Station 13. This firefigher has been with the department for so many years, they are not really sure as to how old he is. Hes nearing his retirement and trying to get as much time on the job that he loves so much before he has to retire. Take in mind, this guys is on both the USAR and Water Rescue team, we find him on Trucks and Engines, and hes still trys to be first-in. When you see him complete his Wildland Fire Training with his crew, its over 100 degrees, hes in his yellows, shovel or rake in hand, and he is out there heading up his crew. During the sit-down training sessions, hes gaining every bit of knowledge they are teaching today, to us, this guys a true Gladitor in the fire service.In this webisode, some of his brothers and sisters in the fire service give him a shout out.

programme.title: Dubai's coolest indoor attractions offer a break from the summer heat
programme.desc: Dubai is known for its year-round sunshine and blue skies but sometimes opting for an indoor attraction can offer a break from the heat. This feature of Life takes you on a tour of the best under-cover attractions the city has to offer. The Green Planet One indoor attraction on offer is The Green Planet - a man-made rainforest that is home to over 3000 species of plants and animals. The unique structure is designed specifically to be the ideal habitat for tropical plants and animals despite being in the middle of the Dubai desert. There are a range of attractions at the Green Planet - most notably the piranha tank where over 1,000 of the fish are on display. Once a day at 16:00 visitors can see a feeding session . Piranhas are notorious for their razor sharp teeth and carnivorous eating habits. Other attractions include the Australian Walkabout - a multi-species exhibit featuring the Australian carpet python, white tree frogs, the lace goanna lizard residing in an abandoned plane and many more. Housing plants and animals from such a contrasting climate to Dubais requires sophisticated technology. Sara Stevens is the curator of The Green Planet: "The glass for the windows was imported from overseas to be 82 UV penetrable to allow for all those nutrients to come in. Even the misting system is digital and automatic to make sure that if the humidity drops below 80 percent in the building it sprays on every level to provide the perfect environment for all the animals." Sara Stevens said the facility is a chance for young people to learn about conservation first-hand: "It’s one thing to of course learn about conservation in the classroom but it’s another to come here, experience a bird flying by you, a sloth next to you and see where the ginger, vanilla or chocolate that you eat comes from and the plants that are there and then learn how important it is to conserve." iFly Dubai If you have always wanted to experience the feeling of skydiving without having to jump out of a plane or off of a cli

programme.title: Namie Osawa
programme.desc: You had me at, "Futuristic robots and sexy Japanese babes fighting off monsters!"We sat down with Namie Osawa, owner and founder of the world famous Robot Restaurant and her team. Namie’s futuristic robot-inspired venue is as visually stimulating as it is entertaining and interactive. She walks us through her inspiration for what now has become a staple experience for locals and global travellers.Interview: NAMIE OSAWA I opened Robot Restaurant three years ago. Even though I was hesitant to show the first concept to foreigners and so forth, I decided to open the restaurant in Kabukicho with the Japanese Businessman in mind. When thinking about what would be appealing to a businessman, I thought about Robots - which I longed for as a kid,..and Girls in sexy costumes. These were the things that initially came to mind. Our rehearsals begin at 11 o’clock in the morning including Wadaiko, which is a Japanese drum dance. We practice for about an hour and thirty minutes, then we have a brief meeting before the show. Rehearsals can be tough, but whatever we go over, ..it’s amazing and we have fun and I think it’s very good. Still, I think that there is a part where not a lot of the content catches on with the audience. Even after repeated viewings, I would like to think that each show was better than the one before it. But on the name alone, people were intrigued and when it arrived, it was beyond the imagination because I wanted it to be a thoughtful experience. Always keep going forward, it’s what we want out of this show. I want to make sure there’s more to it than just a name.

programme.title: Taste Dubai: An Emirati Iftar
programme.desc: During Ramadan, practising Muslims abstain from eating and drinking during daylight hours. The meal that follows is known as Iftar, and you do not have to be Muslim to partake in one. In this edition of Taste, Euronews visited the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray Hotel in Dubai, to sample the special Iftar menu produced by the worlds first Emirati chef. After Athan, the call for evening prayer, Muslims who have been fasting all day can finally eat and drink. The fast is broken by first eating dates. This is of great religious significance, chef Musabbeh Al Kaabi explained. "Prophet Mohammed used to do this when he was breaking his fast, so we always break it with the dates then laban (a fermented milk drink) or water," he said. Chef Musabbeh first served up a traditional dish - king rice. Its name comes from its historically prestigious status as an expensive dish only eaten by royalty or the rich. "Liver is there, beef is there, saffron rice is there. So it’s all luxury things. I have cooked saffron rice, I have fried cauliflower, boiled chickpeas. Now I need to take the flavour of the onions with all these things," Chef Musabbeh said as he prepared the dish. "I will put the rice in now. I’ll put some spices in as well. So now, I’m going to put it on a plate, and I’m going to garnish it" But, before eating, everyone said Bismillā, which means in the name of Allah. Chef Musabbeh then prepared his second dish the famous Emirati ouzi with oriental rice, a lamb dish with cinnamon and cardamom. You can make the dish yourself by following the recipe below: Chef Musabbehs Ouzi and Oriental Rice Recipe Ingredients: 1100g lamb shank 500g of basmati rice 100g of minced lamb 2 bay leaves 3 cinnamon sticks 10g of garlic - freshly chopped 120g of onion - freshly chopped 100g of tomato - freshly chopped 20g of ghee butter Salt and pepper 6.5ml of water 10g of tamarind powder 40g of Emirati spices 30g of tomato paste 40g of coriander - freshly chopped Instructions: 1. programme.title: Balloon trip gives passengers a real bird’s eye view of the desert
programme.desc: Ballooning is the earliest form of human flight. In 18th century France, King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette watched as the first passengers - a duck, a rooster and a sheep - took off in one from Versailles . These days it’s a big attraction for tourists the world over. But in Dubai, hot air ballooning comes with a twist. You can fly with a peregrine falcon. Falconer Dylan Freeman says its the only place in the world where you can fly with the fastest animal on the planet. “What were trying to simulate here is having the falcon soaring. “Theyve been recorded reaching speeds of 389 km/h in a dive. From one kilometre up he can see a pigeon four kilometres away. So then he would fly above it, fold up his wings, and dive down really quickly to try and catch it.” Peter Kollar, co-founder and chief pilot of Balloon Adventures Dubai , says dawn is a good time to take to the skies. “Its a beautiful area because its a mix of desert, pristine desert …… and there are green oases in the desert, which gives a beautiful contrast.” Kollar says the route the balloon takes is very much up to the weather. “Eighty per cent of my work is meteorology. If we get the weather right my job is relatively simple. Really ballooning is true flying because you have to use Mother Nature.”

programme.title: What to do in Pompano Beach
programme.desc: One of South Florida’s hidden gems is Pompano Beach, Florida. Located just north of Fort Lauderdale, this quiet beach town is perfect for those who prefer less crowds and a laid back atmosphere. It’s ideal location makes access to other South Florida towns, including Miami, super easy. I start my journey at the Fort Lauderdale Marriott Pompano Beach Resort & Spa. It has the most amazing sunrises which I delighted in each day from my private balcony. The hotel is located directly on the beach which makes it very difficult to leave. I visit the charming beachside town of Lauderdale by the Sea, a 10 minute drive from my hotel. I also take a tour at Butterfly World, the first and largest butterfly house in the United States. It is home over 80 species of butterflies, hummingbird and lorikeet aviaries, and outdoor gardens. This place is truly magical for people of all ages. Pompano Beach is the quintessential beach town. You can truly relax and enjoy the beach at your own pace while indulging as much or as little as you’d like.

programme.title: Find out why medical tourism is big business in Dubai
programme.desc: Medical tourism is a booming global industry, estimates on market size vary but the Patients Without Borders publishing group puts its value at around €60 to €80 billion worldwide, each year, with 20 to 24 million patients travelling for medical treatments annually. Around the world, aging populations, rising healthcare costs, and pressures on the insurance industry have created opportunities for destinations like Dubai , that have been able to invest rapidly in their healthcare infrastructure and capitalise on the sharp increase in demand for health tourism. Encouraging international institutions Dr Marwan Mohamed Al Mulla, CEO, Health Regulation Sector, Dubai Health Authority said, “Recently a new law has come into effect which encourages and allows international institutions to have their own, 100 percent ownership The Dubai Health Authority has had a medical tourism strategy in place since 2014 with the aim of developing and supporting its healthcare sector and steadily increasing its contribution towards Dubais gross domestic product. Focusing on an inbound patient’s airport-to-airport needs has helped providers capitalise too. Dr Basel Nasrallah, Medical Director, Armada said, “We in our facility, for example, get about 5 percent more patients from abroad. Patients are coming from all around the world. We are receiving patients from Russia, mainly Europe, Italy, Spain, UK, and North America from Africa, from South Asia Why have health checks in Dubai? Interestingly, many of those countries are known for the strength of their own medical tourism offerings, but Dubai is still an attractive option for patients who are looking to combine their treatments with other pursuits. Alexander Edwards, Surgical Patient, from the UK said, “Well there were multiple aspects I looked at prior to coming obviously looking at the time it takes, for the recovery period. I had all the research done before I came and found some fantastic reviews, very positive feedback from other friends and family that

programme.title: Duck de Chine
programme.desc: When you think Beijing, you think ancient history, bustling metropolis and duck. There arent many meals that can claim royal lineage dating back almost a thousand years to the ancient emperors of China. Known as Peking Duck, Beijing Duck or Chinese Roast Duck , this dish is a signature staple of the city and you could spend weeks soul searching and taste testing your way through a variety of recipes (yes, even KFC has one). To save you time, Duck de Chine is one of the annual contenders for the best roast duck in the land and offers an extravagant dining experience. An impressive and inviting décor, complete with vermillion fabrics, dazzling chandeliers, cozy brick walls and large round tables, offers a luxury setting to indulge in the local specialty. Whether you enjoy sugar or spice, a variety of delicious sides accompany the glistening moist meat of this whole duck, prepared over the open flames of 60 year old Jujube wood. Pro tip: dip the crispy skin directly in the raw sugar and enjoy the ride. Smaller dishes, a separate dim sum menu and a full champagne bar are also available so set aside plenty of time to plant yourself in this beautiful dining room and feast away like its 1330.

programme.title: Why day-trippers and holidaymakers are hooked on Dubai Marina
programme.desc: The glories of Dubai Marina Dubai Marina is much more than just a glamorous urban dock for luxury yachts (although its that as well!) Its also home to a huge range of chic bars and restaurants to suit all tastes and moods. And, of course, it has those iconic towers that define its famous skyline. One of the best ways to admire the architecture around Dubai Marina is from the deck of a boat. You can charter a private yacht, hop onboard an organised boat tour - or you can even cross the marina for as little as €2 in a water taxi. Five-star resorts hug the coastline. Their vast, marble-clad lobbies lead to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunch venues and postcard-perfect beaches. As for Dubai Marinas beach clubs, from Drift to Zero Gravity , they are dizzyingly beautiful; their pool decks are catwalks for the latest swimwear fashions. Jumereirah Beach Residence Jumeirah Beach Residence itself is the largest single-phase commercial and residential project in the world. Its strategically lined along a chic waterfront strip known as The Walk , feautring stunning 3D murals. The Walk has a very varied range of fashion, home and handicraft shops and boutiques. The outdoor pop-up market stalls offer jewellery, food treats and homeware, as well as performances by street entertainers. Jumereirah Beach Residence is made up of 40 high-rise buildings divided into six clusters, all with superb access to first-class retailers, entertainment venues and restaurants. Up on the Flying Cup The adjacent cosmopolitan shopping area The Beach has many attractions, including the floating adventure park Aqua Fun . This amazing water park makes a statement, by spelling out "I ♡ Dubai" via is pools and slides when seen from above. Another highlight at The Beach is The Flying Cup , a ride that you can sit in and be elevated to fabulous views, seen in all their glory from 40 metres up - while eating and drinking! From the top, you can see Ain Dubai, Palm Jumeirah and, of course, that wonderful Duba

programme.title: Toh A
programme.desc: In the wave of casual fine dining sweeping Asia, Toh A offers French-Taiwanese fusion that packs a nice punch. In addition to the set menu of excellence, the next most intriguing part of the restaurant is surely its interior design. Built during the Japanese colonial period, the building is over a hundred years old and was even used as a previous dormitory for the National Taiwan University. The original wooden rooftop still remains within the walled gates that open up to modern , Asian interior design that immediately make the outside world melt away. With a rotational set menu, Toh A offers a culinary experience that presents traditional Taiwanese cuisine with a modern French twist unlike any other establishment in Taipei today.

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.title: Duncan Lin
programme.desc: The Story of Duncan Lin“From my earliest memory, I have always liked drawing, but have never thought about making it my career,” says Duncan Lin, one of Taiwan’s most popular comics artists from Hualien. With a fanbase of 20 million and growing, Duncan has been approached by various renowned companies, such as Line, Asus, and TVBS for creative collaborations. He uses a caricature of himself as the main protagonist in his comics, which are centered around the hilarious going-ons of his daily life. With the cameras rolling, he wears his character as a mask, not wishing to expose his face. He is about 5’3, with a skinny frame, his dyed blonde hair peeking out from behind his mask. “My father always objected to my interest in drawing, but my mother was rather supportive. Some of my most precious memories are of those childhood drawings. I would show them to my mother, deeply excited, and she would look at them and say, ‘Oh, that’s [a] really nice picture’, and then display it on the fridge using a magnet. And I would feel so proud every time she did this. I would think, ‘Wow, I need to draw more, because I want more things to be displayed on the fridge’, and then slowly…. the fridge got filled up. And the old drawings would be removed, and the whole process would be repeated. And this small matter, and that fridge, they influenced me, and allowed me to feel like perhaps I should continue drawing in the future.”On the other hand, Duncan’s father was a strict figure, quite the opposite of his mother. “My father never smiled at me from the day I was born till the day he passed away. He never genuinely smiled at me and was always kind of distant - he’s a very, very strict kind of father - so we never really talked much, and of course after I graduated from high school, I left home.” Like all typical Asian parents, Duncan’s father hammered the notion: ‘do not pursue art because you’ll starve to death’, and that if he became an artist, ‘you’ll only earn money after you’re dead’.During his university years, Duncan majored i

programme.title: Kanda
programme.desc: One way to think about Kanda is to picture early Brooklyn, before the hipsters completely took over. It’s a place that perfectly embodies old and new Tokyo, a university town that attracts more than students. It’s a great place to live (some even think it’s one of the best kept secrets of Tokyo) with just about everything you need in one place — restaurants, nightlife, shopping, and easy access to just about any other part of the city. While tall gleaming skyscrapers haven’t taken over the landscape like much of Tokyo, there’s a good balance of historical and contemporary architecture to keep things interesting.Walk around and you’ll find neighborhood pockets that focusing on one thing: an entire street of used bookstores, another with stores and stores hawking vintage and new guitars; a three-story mecca for old-school arcade games; an entire block for ski and snowboarding gear. You can find Michelin-starred restaurants, gyoza specialists, internationally known ramen shops, and even great burger joints around the corner from each other. With friendly and fiercely proud locals who want to share the area’s history, from origami to the Kanda Myojin Shrine, this is a quieter part of Tokyo just waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: "Veganity": World's largest vegan restaurant opened in Dubai
programme.desc: There is an undeniable trend towards a plant-based diet. In the UK, the number of vegans reportedly quadrupled between 2014 and 2018. Even fast-food giants are now offering vegan alternatives to meat. And here in Dubai, a restaurant billed as the worlds largest vegan restaurant (‘Veganity’) has just opened its doors. Veganity’s founder Sky Sommer’s business was borne of her desire to show people that having a plant-based diet does not have to be a sacrifice. With over 200 dishes on the menu, everything from soul food to gourmet food are on offer. Sommer’s favourite dish is Molokhia; a recipe which has its roots in Ancient Egypt. “Its actually the name of a leaf; a greeny leaf that looks like spinach. So you just put olive oil, onions and garlic and coriander. This is what gives it that kick. Tomato paste, white vinegar, vegetable stock. Once you add the molokhia and the tomato paste you just let it boil to render down a bit. It becomes a bit thick and then you just get a hand blender.” Below weve provided a delicious Vegan recipe for you to try at home. Recipe Laham Ajeen Chop tomatoes x4 Diced onions x2 Garlic diced x8 Parsley chopped x1 bunch Red capsicum small squares x1 Green capsicum small squares x1 Minced meat (TVP) 250g Cook all together with 3-4 tablespoons of olive oil for around 10 minutes then add the spices below until they are well combined: Paprika x 4 tablespoons 7 spices x 4 tablespoons Garlic powder x 2 tablespoons Vegan Worcester sauce x 1 tablespoons Tomato paste x 4 tablespoons Vegetable stock x 1 cup Leave to marinate for up to 1 hour stirring it every 15 min till all liquids have dissolved then serve with half a lemon slice. programme.title: Inaugural Black Enterprise Tech Connect Summit
programme.desc: We’re on location in Silicon Valley for the inaugural Black Enterprise Tech Connext Summit, where we’re expanding opportunities for African Americans in the tech space. Caretha Coleman, chairman of the Board at Dignity Health and principal at Coleman Consulting, is one of our first Summit Trailblazer Award honorees for her work opening doors for women and young people of color in the tech world. Then, we have a one-on-one with Jennifer Jones, vice president of Diversity Markets for AT&T. She explains why it’s important to expose college students to opportunities in the tech industry. And finally, we have a Panel Discussion to help tech entrepreneurs get the necessary skills needed to create the perfect pitch that engages potential investors. Our panelists include Carol Sands, founder and managing member of Angels Forum; Donray Von, founder of Castleberry & Co., June Riley, CEO of VC Taskforce; and Charles Hudson, partner of SoftTech VC.

programme.title: Taking Over a Family Business
programme.desc: Sisters Alisa Lawrence and Nilaja Young, along with their husbands, and with investment from their mom, bought New England Sweetwater Farm & Distillery from their cousin.

programme.title: Football Great Deion Sanders Talks Family, Fame and Football
programme.desc: Football hall of famer and major league baseball star Deion Sanders tells us about fame, family and fatherhood. Then Adenah Bayoh gives us a glimpse of her extraordinary journey from war survivor in Africa to successful businesswoman in America, with one of the fastest growing restaurants in the Northeast. We offer career tips from Tamil Robinson, who tells us about his transition from air brushing jackets to designing NFL Pro-Bowl Jerseys to wowing crowds at New York Fashion week. And finally, we introduce a new a program dedicated to taking the imagination to new heights with Disney’s Dreamer’s Academy.

programme.title: Get Out of Your Own Way
programme.desc: Vernice K. Bell, the CEO of marketing agency 18 FortyThree LLC, helps entrepreneurs get unstuck and grow their businesses

programme.title: Lynae Vanee Talks Power, Purpose, and 'The People’s Brief'
programme.desc: Multi-hyphenate creator, poet, and cultural commentator Lynae Vanee steps into the spotlight as the host of "The People’s Brief," REVOLT’s raw and unapologetic news commentary series. In this exclusive Black Enterprise interview with Selena Hill, the three-time NAACP Image Award nominee shares her journey from high school teacher to digital powerhouse, and unpacks her vision for truth-telling, creative freedom, and the future of Black America.

programme.title: Mind Over Money: Suited To Prosper
programme.desc: Inspired by the wisdom and example of his mother, Travis Shuler developed a passion for fashion and style and a belief in the spirit of entrepreneurship, ultimately leading to his launch of Columbia, S.C.-based Suit Yourself Menswear. Shuler joins Beyond The Hype to give insight into how his perspective on money has evolved on his journey to business ownership and defines the legacy of wealth-creation he plans to leave to his children.

programme.title: Backstage with Bell Biv DeVoe
programme.desc: We go backstage with Bell Biv DeVoe as they get ready for their long-anticipated New Edition reunion tour. Then we catch up with Curtis Benjamin, the founder of Save Our Daughters.” Hes on a mission to help daughters around the country. Then we talk to Ron Hickland, the engineer behind some of Americas top performing bowling balls. Hes shows us the career benefits of a STEM education. And finally, Dr. Khalil Muhammad shows us how hes lifting his community through the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture.

programme.title: Dolphins: Stray Noises or Intelligent Communication?
programme.desc: Dolphins are regarded as one of Earth's most intelligent animals and capable of sending information to each other. This program studies their intellectual similarities to humans and asks: Do dolphins have the capacity to understand human communication?

programme.title: Easter Island Monuments: Native Craftsmen or Other Worldly Creations?
programme.desc: Easter Island is famous for its monumental statues called Moai. These eighty ton monolithic statues were transported several miles and arranged in rows on raised platforms. How did the Rapa Nui create and transport them? Most intriguing is ‘Why’?

programme.title: Angel Maker: Serial Killer Queen
programme.desc: In the 19th century, England controlled the biggest Empire the world had ever seen. Scientific breakthroughs, huge scale engineering, and great leaps in medicine led Britain's reign of global power. And yet, behind the facade there was a darkness. An unimaginable world of evil - theft, rape, murder and more. This was the real world of Jack the Ripper and Sherlock Holmes. But there was a lesser known killer on the loose who was far worse than any of the others, a woman who would succeed in becoming one of the world's most prolific serial killers. Her name was Amelia Dyer and she killed over 400 innocent babies. A seemingly gentle old lady, Amelia would take in children under the guise of nurturing and caring for them when in reality she starved and strangled them to death. Explore inconceivable recesses of humanity in this shockingly true story of human darkness and depravity at the turn of the century.

programme.title: 3-All Hallows Eve: The Dead Have Stories to Tell
programme.desc: Three tales of terror to make your flesh creep and your heart pound. Deadly spirits, back from the grave with vengeance in mind, give fuel to these tales of supernatural horror. This awesome anthology includes a story adapted from the work of master horror writer Gary Brandner author of "The Howling." Demons from beyond, souls seeking revenge and more for the scariest Halloween of all.

programme.title: 3:15 AM
programme.desc: LONG - Horror strikes at 3:15 AM in ways never before imagined. Truth is stranger than fiction in this euro horror anthology that opens a new dimension in sheer terror. This cutting edge horror anthology from France will curl your toes and rattle your soul.

programme.title: Journey Through the Dolomites
programme.desc: Experience the spectacular Dolomites mountain range in Italy: dramatic stone spires, vast alpine meadows, charming villages, and brilliant blue lakes. Run time approx. 90 minutes.

programme.title: The Pacific Coast
programme.desc: Experience the natural beauty of the Pacific Coast from Washington State to Southern California. See breathtaking video of spectacular sunsets and iconic locations along the Big Sur coast. The photography and cinematography of Olof and Elizabeth Carmel are paired with relaxing music to provide an exquisite "ambient art" experience for TV and mobile devices.

programme.title: Preview for "Autumn's Grace: The Wasatch Mountains"
programme.desc: The Wasatch mountains of Utah display natures finest autumn colors. The stunning spectrum of the landscape ranges from dark reds to bright yellows, splashed across the mountains in exuberant splendor. A soothing acoustic soundtrack accompanies the scenery, filmed from above and within the autumn splendor of the Wasatch mountains. This is a free preview for the 1 hour 50 minute film available to subscribers at www.NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Big Sur
programme.desc: Journey through Big Sur, a renowned stretch of the California Coast featuring amazing cliffs & sea stacks, beaches, wildflowers, redwood forests, sealife, and brilliant ocean waters. Spectacular cinematography is accompanied by a soothing soundtrack of music and ocean waves. Runtime 90 minutes.

programme.title: Preview For "Yosemite Waterfalls & Wildflowers" 2 Hour Relaxing Nature Film
programme.desc: Available to stream on May 29, 2021. In the Spring Yosemites spectacular waterfalls combine with an exquisite display of Dogwood blossoms to create an awe inspiring experience like no other. Immerse yourself in the wonders of Yosemite in this 2 hour relaxing nature film "Yosemite, Waterfalls & Wildflowers". The spectacular cinematography is accompanied by a beautiful acoustic guitar soundtrack. Available at www.NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Preview for "California's Wild Coast"
programme.desc: Soar with the seabirds over the wild and beautiful north coast of California. The rugged coastline of Mendocino is a vast wilderness full of wildlife, sea caves, bird colonies, and crashing waves that can only be fully appreciated from an aerial view. This 2.5 hour film is an exhilarating flight over this magnificent landscape. Soul stirring ambient music accompanies the spectacular cinematography of "Californias Wild Coast". The full film is available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv

programme.title: Point Reyes National Seashore & Oregon Coast Sea Stacks
programme.desc: Enjoy over 2 hours of beautiful vistas our newest Ambient Nature Film "Point Reyes Seashore & Oregon Coast Sea Stacks". Explore the dramatic beauty of Point Reyes National Seashore & the stunning sea stacks of the Oregon Coast. Experience the calming effect of the seashore paired with a beautiful soundtrack. Feel your worries melt away, your heart rate slow, and breath deepen with each relaxing scene.

programme.title: Ballroom Boxing
programme.desc: John Terry vs Michael Dickerson and more

programme.title: Ballroom Boxing
programme.desc: James McCallister vs Jameel Wilson and more

programme.title: Drake Vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E16 Drake went from hip hop hero to deadbeat dad when Kanye West collaborator Pusha T revealed Drake was hiding a secret son, but why was he hiding his son in the first place? And how did Pusha know about it?Everybody assumed Kanye had leaked the information because he was threatened by Drake’s success, but the truth is way more complicated.After digging into Drake and Kanye’s feud and friendship, our team discovered the real story behind Drake’s secret son and the journey he went on to embrace fatherhood for himself.

programme.title: Gwen Stefani vs. Gavin Rossdale
programme.desc: S1:E3 When Gwen Stefani’s happy 20-year relationship with Gavin Rossdale came crashing down, and she started dating Blake Shelton right after the divorce, the media went crazy. Discover the real story of the months of media torture Gwen had to go through, and where she is now in her new relationship with her new man.

programme.title: Kim Kardashian & Pete Davidson Vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E14 The whole world witnessed Kim and Kanyes marriage fall apart. At first it seemed like they were supporting each other through their divorce, but suddenly Kanye started to publicly attack Kim, accusing her of exploiting and kidnapping their children. What happened? Our team did some digging and traced it all back to Kims performance on SNL. Everyone assumes Kanye’s attacks are because of Pete Davidson, but we uncovered the real reason Kanye turned against Kim Kardashian.

programme.title: Jennifer Aniston vs. Brangelina
programme.desc: S1:E12 For almost 20 years, the media portrayed Jennifer Aniston as a heartbroken woman who would never be happy until she had kids. That couldn’t be further from the truth. Our team uncovered details that will prove Brad and Jennifer were the perfect Hollywood couple everybody adored, until Brad suddenly left Jen for Angelina Jolie. This story is so much bigger than Brangelina.

programme.title: Drake Bell vs. Josh Peck
programme.desc: S1:E15 Everyone loved Drake & Josh but people don’t know the dark story behind the world’s favorite kids’ show. Josh struggled with his weight and addiction while filming the show. It was always painful for him to be the chubby sidekick to the cool, popular Drake. Then Josh shocked the world when he revealed that he and Drake weren’t even really friends. Drake was furious, sparking a massive backlash against Josh. But no one knew just how dark of a path Drake had gone down.

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise Of Fredia Gibbs
programme.desc: S1:E6 Fredia Gibbs was the first female African American kickboxing world champion who learned how to fight as a child because she grew up scared and afraid. It wasn’t until she unknowingly got into a van alone after a party with a man who turned out to be a serial killer, that all the years of fighting and training would help her unleash the power she had inside of her and catapult her to new heights.

programme.title: The Rise Of Damien Rider
programme.desc: S1:E7 Damien Rider was beaten up, thrown against walls, and left all by himself as a child because of an abusive stepfather. After four attempts to end his own life, he decided he needed to deal with his demons by doing the most extreme thing he could do. Discover why Damien felt like he needed to paddle through a deadly ocean and why when he was just about to quit, the entire trajectory of his life would be permanently changed forever.

programme.title: Katelyn Ohashi: For The Perfect 10
programme.desc: Top USA gymnast Katelyn Ohashi was the best gymnast in the world, until she became the target of relentless body shaming from her coach and social media. The elite gymnastics industry is notorious for body shaming, and when coach Valorie Kondos took over at UCLA, Katelyn rebelled against the stereotypes and her revenge went viral.

programme.title: Chris Gardner: CEO of Happyness
programme.desc: Goalcast EXCLUSIVE! ﻿﻿Remember the movie "The Pursuit of Happyness" starring Will Smith? Some may not know that Chris Gardner is the REAL person behind Will Smiths character.﻿﻿ But until now, a BIG part of his story was never told. In this Goalcast Original, Chris finally opens up to the world about WHAT HAPPENED to him after losing the love of his life.

programme.title: Curtis Martin: Running Towards Success
programme.desc: Legendary NFL Player Curtis Martin enjoyed great success playing for the New England Patriots and the New York Jets. After retiring, he was inducted to the Pro Football Hall of Fame…. yet he openly admits that he really didn’t want to play football and that he was forced into it. What dark trauma from his childhood almost kept him from realizing his true dream and the greatest opportunity of his life?

programme.title: Surviving A Serial Killer
programme.desc: S1:E2 Lisa McVey did not want to live past 17 years old, and on the day she wrote her goodbye letter, was snatched in the street. For the next 26 hours, it was up to Lisa to outsmart her captor, later identified as serial killer Bobby Joe Long.

programme.title: Dave Chappelle Tells All
programme.desc: You may love or hate Dave Chappelle, but he did the right thing here. One minute he was the hottest comedian in the country and completely vanished the next. Discover how racism pushed him out of show business and why it’s fuelling his return.

programme.title: Katie Beers: The Girl In The Wall
programme.desc: Spaceplex is 9 year old Katie Beers’ favorite spot, before she’s abducted at that same location in December 1992, just before her birthday. For 17 days, the investigators dig into the family’s lies, each more suspicious than the next, hoping to find the lost girl. Katie is trapped in the wall, but she still has her wits, which will eventually lead to justice against her kidnappers.

programme.title: The Kardashian Redemption - The Unauthorized Documentary
programme.desc: When OJ Simpson destroyed her family, Kim Kardashian avenged her father, Robert Kardashian.

programme.title: Deontay Wilder - Box For Life
programme.desc: American heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder reveals the heartbreaking reason why he got into boxing and the one person who inspired him to never give up fighting to become the World Champion.

programme.title: Christine Ha: Courage in the Kitchen
programme.desc: In this exclusive Goalcast Original, the first blind contestant and winner of MasterChef, Christine Ha, opens up about how she lost her sight and her mother at a young age. These formative experiences shaped who she is today and pushed her to never give up on her dreams and finding ways to connect with the spirit of her mother.

programme.title: "How Much Does It Take to Retire Comfortably on a $5k, $10k, or $15k/mo Budget?"
programme.desc: Have you ever been told that you need to have at least a million dollars for you to retire comfortably? Many people have been frustrated by the idea that theres an arbitrary magic number they need to reach to retire. The truth is, retirement planning isnt one-size-fits-all, and the amount you need depends on many factors.

programme.desc: Hokkaido, Japan is home to the largest recorded snowfall of any region. Storms from the Aleutian chain pound the North Island and afford some of the deepest powder riding in the world.

programme.title: Backpacking Utah's Canyon Country
programme.desc: Showcasing the people, places and adventures that surround the world’s top backpacking trails, Epic Trails is an exciting and inspiring adventure travel series hosted by Eric Hanson. An avid backpacker, knowledgeable wilderness explorer and passionate adventurer, Eric has a strong presence in the online backpacking community and shares his adventures in an approachable and inspirational way.

programme.title: Soul Purpose HD
programme.desc: Soul Purpose takes an introspective look at the driving forces behind athletes' devotion to skiing. Experience the athlete‚Äôs highs and lows, get a glimpse of their lives, and discover Soul Purpose.

programme.title: Ice Edge
programme.desc: Ice Edge is a short documentary about a group of surfers trying to make surfboards out of ice. It follows the process from freezing the boards, shaping them and taking them out into the sea. There is a lot of trying and failing. Will it work at all? The boards are slippery, and they melt very fast. Everything needs to work simultaneously: The surfers must be ready. The boards cannot crack. The perfect wave must come. Ice Edge is a film where nature and people play together.

programme.title: Whitewater Kayaking the Ottawa River
programme.desc: The whitewater section of the Ottawa River is world-renowned, attracting paddlers from around the globe, and the warm, deep waters are an ideal place for young paddlers to learn. Join host, Ken Whiting, as he and his 8-year-old daughter tackle the whitewater together in separate kayaks for the first time.

programme.title: Kayak Fishing Lake Erie
programme.desc: Fishing and kayaking is an unbeatable combination, as it allows you to fish in places inaccessible by boat or foot. Join host, Ken Whiting, as he meets up with Baer Fishing Adventures to chase pike and bass from their kayaks in the marshes surrounding Long Point Bay in Southern Ontario's Norfolk County.

programme.title: Fire On The Mountain
programme.desc: Join a cast of some of the world's finest athletes on a spontaneous journey of skiing, snowboarding, surfing, and music, complete with a soundtrack comprised of only Grateful Dead music.

programme.title: Sea Kayaking the 1000 Islands
programme.desc: The crystal-clear waters of Lake Ontario are home to a spectacular group of islands known as the 1000 Islands – and there’s 1000 good reasons to visit. Join host, Ken Whiting, as he explores the must-see local paddling spots by sea kayak.

programme.title: Accomplice Athlete Edits
programme.desc: Join the athletes featured in Teton Gravity Research's "Accomplice" on a whirlwind tour around the world as they push the limits of what's possible on a mountain bike.

programme.title: Shangri La
programme.desc: Join Jeremy Jones and the Teton Gravity Research team as Jeremy makes his second attempt to climb and ride Shangri-La, a massive line on a remote Himalayan peak while filming for Higher, TGR's 2014 snowboard film.

programme.title: LIVE: Michelin 12H Paul Ricard
programme.desc: LIVE: Michelin 12H Paul Ricard

programme.title: Garden Party
programme.desc: Ready to dig in and grow your green thumb? Join us for a delightful hour of expert-led gardening tutorials designed to inspire and educate gardeners of all levels. From essential planting tips and soil secrets to creative container gardening and vibrant floral arrangements, our seasoned instructors will guide you through every step. Whether you're a seasoned horticulturist or just starting out, you'll find fresh ideas and practical techniques to cultivate the garden of your dreams.

programme.title: Fly Away
programme.desc: Let's make wings and fly. With paper, scissors and a little spaghetti, Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes paper feathers. Then, she crafts fuzzy bug wings from felt. Artist Franz Spohn illustrates distance and perspective in his drawings of birds in flight. Jenny crafts a bird house for our feathered friends.

programme.title: Wings
programme.desc: Our creativity takes to the air. Jenny Barnett-Rohrs and Katie Hacker make sparkly wings and Katie creates a funny spoon bird. Franz Spohn creates see-through bug wings and we'll make a very special chalkboard gift for Mom or Dad.

programme.title: Four-Color Fruit Slices Quilt
programme.desc: This one's a total strip show! (Well, sort of.) Angela's strip-piecing secrets can help you breeze through the blocks, sashing and border of a beautiful quilt.

programme.title: CLUB HABANA
programme.desc: Barbara is about to travel to Spain for an exhibition of her paintings. The night before starting her journey there is a hurricane and she has to stay in a nightclub until the morning. During the night she comes into contact with different people who have a variety of conflicts and interests. She is drawn into this microcosm which seems to be a reflection of Cuban society today.

programme.title: ANY MINUTE NOW
programme.desc: When her parents decide to separate, sixteen year old Anna Brooks is sent to spend the summer in a small coastal town with her old fashioned aunt and uncle, Jennifer and David Collingwood. Anna is narcoleptic and suffers traumatic hallucinations as side effects to her medication. Whilst living in small town suburbia several bizarre incidents take place which lead Anna to question her own sanity. Is it really all in her head or is something more sinister going on in the small sleepy town?

programme.title: Bloody war in Xiang River Part II
programme.desc: After the central column crossed the Xiangjiang River from the Jieshou pontoon bridge, enemy planes blew up the pontoon bridge. The 34th Division of the Fifth Red Army was ordered to block the Guangxi army going north from Guanyang. Due to changes in the enemys situation and unfamiliarity with the terrain, they lost in the mountains of northern Guangxi and arrived at the ferry late. The leading troops of the Red 8th Army arrived at the Xiangjiang River one after another. At this time, the Jieshou pontoon bridge had been blown up, and the Jieshou Ferry had also been occupied by the Gui army. The Central Revolutionary Military Commission ordered Sword of Xingguo, who had already crossed the river, to return and find a ferry on the Xiangjiang River, and cooperated with the Red 5th Army and the Red 8th Army to cross the river. Through investigation and detection, the Sword of Xingguo successfully found an ancient underwater hidden dam in Fenghuangzui, 10 kilometers downstream of Jieshou, which can be waded. The Red 2nd Division fought fiercely with the Hunan Army. In order to avoid being divided and surrounded, the Red 1st and Red 2nd Divisions retreated to Xiabitian, Shuitou, Chilanpu, and Baishapu successively. The Central Revolutionary Military Commission ordered the Red 1st Army to hold its position at any cost in order to open up a road to the west. Under the cover of aircraft, the Hunan Army launched a fierce attack by adopting the tactics of frontal attack and roundabout encirclement. The Red 1st and Red 2nd Divisions fought hard to cover the main force of the Red Army to cross the Xiangjiang River at noon and march westward. Relying on the condescending favorable terrain, the 10th regiment repelled the Gui armys repeated attacks, and took the initiative to attack in the dark of night to hold its position. The Gui army changed its tactics. While attacking frontally, the main force attacked the 11th and 12th regiments of the 4th Division in Jieshou along the west bank of the Xiang River.
